intro: Podolepis laciniata, commonly known as the lace-leaf podolepis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate, lace-like appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Podolepis laciniata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
